gurmukhi: sXwm hI sXwm sdw khIXo kih kY ieh mopih kwnH pTwXo ] XO kih kY rQ pY ciV kY rQ ko mQurw hI kI Er clwXo ]956]
transliteration: Syaan Hisyaam Sadaa Kaheeyo Kah(i) Kai Eh Mopah(i) Kaahn Pathaayo Yaoun Kah(i) Rath Pai Chad(i) Kai Rath Ko Mathuraa Hikior Chalaayo||956||
translation: Udhava said to them, “Krishna has sent me to you to instruct you regarding the remembrance of the name of the Lord;” saying this Udhava mounted on his chariot and started for Matura.956.
Speech of Udhava addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: Awie qbY mQurw pur mY blrwm Aau sXwm ky pwie prXy ] khXy jy qum my kwic kY pinXy iqn sy ieh BwNq hI sy auceXy ]
transliteration: Ooe Tabai Mathuraa Pur Mai Balraam Au Syaam Ke Paae Daryo|| Kahyo Jo Toum Mo Kah(i) Kai Pathiyo Tin So Eh Bhaant Hiso Ouchryo||
translation: After reaching Mathura, Udhava bowed at the feet of Krishna and Balram and said, “O Krishna ! whatever you had asked me to say, I have done accordingly;

gurmukhi: sMg nMd ky Aau gwrin ky crcw kir gXwn kI Pyr iPrXy ] qumry muK Bwn inhwrq hI qum sy duK by sB dUr krXy ]957]
transliteration: San Nand Ke Au Oun Gvaaran(i) Ke Charchaa Kar(i) Gyaan Kipher Phiryo|| Toumro Moukh Bhaan Nihaarat Hitoum So Doukh Tho Sabh Door Daryo||957||
translation: “I have come back after conversing on topics concerning on divine wisdom with the gopis and Nand and seeing your sun-like face my agony has ended.957.

gurmukhi: qumry pg Byt gXo jb hI qb hI Pun nMd ky Dwm gXo ] iqh ko kir kY hir gXwn pRboD auTXo cil gÍwrin pws AXo ]
transliteration: Toumre Pag Bhet Gado Jab Hitab Hiphoun Nand Ke Dhaam Gado|| Tih Ko Kar(i) Kai Har(i) Gyaan Prabodh Outhyo Chal(i) Gvaaran(i) Paas Ayo||
translation: “Touching your feet, when I started, I reached at first at the house of Nand; after talking to him on matters of divine wisdom, I came to the gopis;

gurmukhi: qumro aun du`K khXo hm pY sun au`qr mY ieh BwNq dXo ] bl sXwmih sXwm sdw jpIXo sun nwmih pRym Gno bFXo ]958]
transliteration: Toumro Oun Doukkh Kahyo Ham Pai Soun Outtar Mai Eh Bhaant Dayo|| Bal Syaamah(i) Syaam Sadaa Japeeyo Soun Naamah(i) Prem Ghano Badhayo||958||
translation: “They related to me their suffering because of their separation from you, I advised them to repeat ever the Name of Krishna; after hearing your name, their love increasd greatly.”958.
Speech regarding the message of Udhava:

gurmukhi: gÍwrin mo sMg AYsy khXo hm Er qy sXwm ky pwien p`eIXY ] XO khIXo pur bwsn ko qij kY biRjbwsn ko suK d`eIXY ]
transliteration: Gvaaran(i) Mo San Aise Kahyo Ham Or Te Syaam Ke Paain Paeeyai|| Yaoun Kaheeyo Pur Baasan Ko Taj(i) Kai Brijbaasan Ko Soukh Daeeyai||
translation: “The gopis asked me to touch your feet on their behalf; they also said : ‘ O Krishna ! now leave the residents of the city and give comfort to the inhabitants of Braja;’

gurmukhi: jsuDw ieh BwNq krI ibnqI khIXo sMg pUq knH`eIXY ] aUDv qw sMg XyN khIXo bhuro iPir Awie kY mwKn K`eIXY ]959]
transliteration: Jasudhaa Eh Bhaant Karibintibintikaheeyo San Poot Kanhaeeyai|| Oodhav Taa San Yaoun Kaheeyo Bahuro Phir(i) Aae Kai Maakhanndkhaeeeeyai||959||
translation: “Yashoda also said, ‘Request my son on my behald to come again and eat the butter.’959.

gurmukhi: Aaur khI ibnqI qum pY su suno Aru Aaurn bwqn fwro ] AYsy khw jsuDw qumko hmko Aiq hI biRjnwQ ipAwro ]
transliteration: Aur Kahibintitoum Pai Su Souno Ar(u) Auran Baatan Daro|| Aise Kahaa Jasudhaa Toumko At(i) Hibrijnaath Pdaro||
translation: “They have also requested you, OKrishna ! listen to that also; Yashoda said that the Lord of Braja was very dear to them,
